method.name: ARMMGA

reference.ref: H.R. Qodmanan, M. Nasiri and B. Minaei-Bidgoli. Multi objective association rule mining with genetic algorithm without specifying minimum support and minimum confidence. Expert Systems with Applications, 38:288–298 (2011).

generalDescription.type: Association Rules Mining by means of Genetic Algorithms
generalDescription.objective: The genetic algorithm mines association rules without considering minimum support, conﬁdence and interestingness, and extract the best rules with high values of these measures
generalDescription.howWork: First the initialization population is produced by initialization function and is spotted as the best population. Then if the termination function returns true, the best population is returned as output function, otherwise the selection function is performed on population and the parent's population is selected by it. Then the crossover function is performed on the parents’ population and an offspring population is produced. In next step, the mutation function is performed on some offspring chromosomes and ﬁnally, the ﬁnal population is selected from parent and offspring populations. If the average of ﬁtness of ﬁnal population is larger than the best population of previous stages or if they are equal and the variance of it is larger than or equal to the variance of ﬁtness of the best population of previous stages, the best population is replaced with the current ﬁnal population. The genetic learning is performed iteratively until a maximum number of evaluations is reached. At the end, the best population is returned.

parameterSpec.param: Fixed Length of Association Rules: the fixed length of the mined association rules.
Population Size: the population size to handle after each generation.
Number of Generations: the maximum number of generations to accomplish.
Difference Boundary (NOT USED): the difference between the best and the worst chromosome.
Probability of Selection: the probability of selection.
Probability of Crossover: the probability of crossover.
Probability of Mutation: the probability of mutation.
Number of Partitions for Numeric Attributes: the number of uniform partitions used for splitting numerical domains.

method.example:
Problem type: Association Rules Method: ARMMGA Dataset: basketball Parameters: default values (seed = 1286082570)
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see XML representations of the mined association rules along with the values concerning the measures of interest, respectively, in:
"results/Asso-ARMMGA.basketball/result0s0.tra"
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <rules> <rule id="0"> <antecedents> <attribute name="assists_per_minuteReal" value="[0.19655, 0.270125]"/> </antecedents> <consequents> <attribute name="heightInteger" value="[181.5, 192.25]"/> </consequents> </rule> ... ... ... ... </rules>
"results/Asso-ARMMGA.basketball/result0s0.tst"
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <values> <rule id="0" rule_support="0.23" antecedent_support="0.28" consequent_support="0.49" confidence="0.85" lift="1.73" conviction="3.32" certainFactor="0.7" netConf="0.49" yulesQ="0.82" nAttributes="2"/> ... ... ... ... </values>
Number of Association Rules generated: 1 Average Support: 0.23 Average Confidence: 0.85 Average Lift: 1.73 Average Conviction: 3.32 Average Certain Factor: 0.7 Average Netconf: 0.49 Average YulesQ: 0.82 Average Number of Attributes: 2.0 Number of Covered Records (%): 22.92
"results/Asso-ARMMGA.basketball/result0s0e0.tst"
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <values> Support antecedent_support consequent_support Confidence Lift Conv CF NetConf YulesQ nAttributes 0.23 0.28 0.49 0.58 1.73 3.32 0.7 0.49 0.82 2 </values>
We can also see some relevant information on-screen:
Initialization Generation: 1 Generation: 2 ... ... ... ... Generation: 498
Number of Association Rules generated: 1 Average Support: 0.23 Average Confidence: 0.85 Average Lift: 1.73 Average Conviction: 3.32 Average Certain Factor: 0.7 Average Netconf: 0.49 Average YulesQ: 0.82 Average Number of Attributes: 2.0 Number of Covered Records (%): 22.92
Algorithm Finished
2.545 seconds
